newsitem.title: ESTONIA: KLEMENTI ESTIMATES 7.5 MLN PROFIT IN 1997.
newsitem.headline: KLEMENTI ESTIMATES 7.5 MLN PROFIT IN 1997.

text.p: Estonia's clothing company Klementi said on Wednesday that it estimates its 1997 net profit to grow to 7.5 million kroons from 4.3 million kroons in 1996.
It estimates its net turnover to grow to roughly 100 million kroons, compared to 86 million kroons in 1996, it added in a statement.
The company had a net turnover of 20.7 million kroons in the first quarter of 1997, 1.2 million kroons lower than the same period in 1996.
Its net profit grew by 0.4 million kroons compared to the same period in 1996 to 1.2 million kroons, the company said.
The rise in profits stemmed from savings in production and management costs and to the launch of a real estate project, it said.
The fall in turnover was planned and resulted from a decrease in its capacity to subcontract, the company added.
It plans a substantial increase in net turnover in the second half this year.
Klementi was traded for the second day on the bourse's secondary list on Wednesday.
